author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Southern Railway will operate a Suvidha special train from Tirunelveli to Chennai Egmore to clear the extra rush on April 10. The Tirunelveli-Chennai Egmore Suvidha special train (00602) will leave Tirunelveli at 2.45 p.m. on April 10 and reach Chennai Egmore at 4.15 a.m. the next day. The train will stop at Kovilpatti, Virudhunagar, Madurai, Dindigul, Tiruchi, Villupuram, Chengalpattu, and Tambaram. It would have one AC 2-tier, two AC 3-tier, 12 sleeper class, and two luggage-cum-brake van coaches. Advance reservation for the train is open, a Southern Railway press release said.

Extension of train

The Southern Railway has announced the extension of Nagore-Karaikal Passenger and the Mayiladuthurai-Kumbakonam Passenger special trains. The Nagore–Karaikal–Nagore Passenger special trains (06852/06851) have been extended up July 31 and the Mayiladuthurai-Kumbakonam-Mayiladuthurai (06819/06820) Passenger special trains have been extended for three months till June 23, a release said.
